page.title: 11Landscape & Bldngs Helford.
page.content: Buildings: Mudgeon farmhouse, interesting house especially windows. 17th Cent staircase. Probably built l633 _1640 in its present form. ?tunnel to Frenchmans Pill reputedly for smuggling in former days. Kestle Barton: Built 1550.Coat of Arms Many of the farmhouses and buildings are old and traditional, some are very modern in design with milking parlours and intensive pig feeding etc. There are very pretty thatched cottages at Helford and a small Anglican church no longer in use. Manaccan Chapel built 1867, the original was built 1835. Landscape consists of fields, woods and river and the small village of Helford. Generally very pleasant and unspoilt.
